googleSheetEarlyVotingDataRow.earlyVotingNotesCombined:
*You do not need a reason to vote early! All voters may vote early, just like they are voting on Election Day. Voters who want to vote early for any election may do so in person at their parish [Registrar of Voters Office](https://voterportal.sos.la.gov/registrar) or at designated locations in the parish from 14 to seven days prior to any scheduled election. When one or more state holidays fall within an early voting period, the first day for early voting will begin 15 days prior to the election. Refer to the schedule below for early voting time periods for upcoming elections and refer to the [schedule of elections](https://www.sos.la.gov/ElectionsAndVoting/GetElectionInformation/SearchElectionDates) for future time periods.

* For a detailed list of early voting locations in your parish, login to the [voter portal](https://voterportal.sos.la.gov/). For a complete list of early voting locations for the entire state, please refer to [early voting locations](https://voterportal.sos.la.gov/earlyvoting).

* The registrars of voters will open their offices from 8:30 a.m. to 6 p.m. for each day of early voting. When you go to cast your vote early, you will be asked to identify yourself with either a photo ID or signature on a voter affidavit. You may use a Louisiana driver’s license, a Louisiana special identification card, a United States military identification card that contains the applicant's name and picture or other generally recognized picture identification card that has your name and signature. You may wish to contact your local [Registrar of Voters Office](https://voterportal.sos.la.gov/registrar) for specific locations, dates and times.

* See [La. R.S. 18:1303](http://legis.la.gov/Legis/Law.aspx?d=81337) for more information about voting early.
googleSheetEarlyVotingDataRow.idRequirementsOvr: You can register to vote online if you have a Louisiana driver's license or state ID card. If not, you can register to vote by mail or in person.
googleSheetEarlyVotingDataRow.idRequirementsSdr: Bring your Louisiana driver's license or state ID card with you. If you don't have one, bring ONE photo ID that shows your name, and ONE document that shows your name and current address.  Acceptable documents include a utility bill, bank statement, paycheck, residential lease, or any government document that shows your name and address.
googleSheetEarlyVotingDataRow.registrationRules:
To register in Louisiana you must:

  * be a citizen of the United States
  * be a resident of Louisiana (Residence address must be address where you claim homestead exemption, if any, except for a resident in a nursing home or veterans home who may select to use the address of the nursing home or veterans home or the home where he has a homestead exemption. A college student may elect to use his home address or his address while away at school.)
  * be at least 17 years old (16 years old if registering in person at the Registrar of Voters Office or at the Louisiana Office of Motor Vehicles), and be 18 years old prior to the next election to vote
  * not currently be under an order of imprisonment for conviction of a felony. (If you are under an order but have not been incarcerated within the last five years, you ARE eligible to vote unless your conviction was for election fraud.)
  * not currently be under a judgment of interdiction for mental incompetence
